Celebration Committee Formed in Libya
articles.content:
Celebration Committee Formed in Libya 
    Pyongyang, February 3 (KCNA) -- An inaugural ceremony of a committee for celebrating February 16, birthday of leader   Kim Jong Il, was held in Tarabulus on January 28 under the sponsorship of the Sunbula International Friendship Club.
 At the ceremony General Secretary of the club Salah Deen Al Gashat was elected chairman of the committee.    
 The committee set a celebration period from February 1 to 20 and decided to organize colorful functions.

North Side's Delegation Leaves for Seoul
articles.content:
North Side's Delegation Leaves for Seoul
    Pyongyang, February 3 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the north side headed by Kim Ryong Song, chief councilor of the DPRK Cabinet, left here on Feb. 3 to participate in the 13th north-south ministerial talks to be held in Seoul.
 It was seen off at the airport by Jong Mun San, chief secretary of the Cabinet, An Kyong Ho, director of the Secretariat of the Committee for the Peaceful Reunification of the Fatherland, Jong Un Op, chairman of the National Economic Cooperation Federation, and other officials concerned.

articles.title: Greetings to President of Sri Lanka
articles.content:
Greetings to President of Sri Lanka
    Pyongyang, February 3 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, on Feb.3 sent a message of greetings to Chandrika Bandaranaike Kumaratunga, president of Sri Lanka, on the occasion of the 56th anniversary of the independence of Sri Lanka.
 Expressing belief that the friendly and cooperative relations would grow stronger between the two countries, the message sincerely wished the president and people of Sri Lanka greater success in their work for the stability and prosperity of the country.

articles.title: Greetings to Prime Minister of Sri Lanka
articles.content:
Greetings to Prime Minister of Sri Lanka
    Pyongyang, February 3 (KCNA) -- Pak Pong Ju, premier of the DPRK Cabinet, sent a message of greetings to Prime Minister of Sri Lanka Ranil Wickremasinghe on the occasion of the 56th anniversary of the independence of Sri Lanka.
 The message expressed the belief that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would grow stronger in the interests of the two peoples and sincerely wished the prime minister success in his responsible work.    
 Foreign Minister Paek Nam Sun sent a similar message to his Sri Lankan counterpart Tyronne Fernando.
